image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that led to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: emergency services at a property on Fernleigh Close Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: A 14-year-old boy charged in relation to the death of a nine-year-old at Windellama has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Teen pleads not guilty over accidental shooting death of 9yo near Goulburn

image.altText: A 56-year-old man smiling and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The family of Canberra man Harri Jokinen, who was killed during a high-speed police pursuit on the Monaro Highway in 2021, hopes an inquest into his death will lead to a change in policy.

title.children: Family hopes coronial inquest leads to change in police pursuit policy

image.altText: A brunette woman hugs her elderly mother.

props.synopsis: The ACT government will support Burrangiri Aged Care Respite Centre to stay open for another two years.

title.children: 'I was disgusted': Residents applaud delay of respite service closure

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old Canberra man pleads not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court to allegedly performing a Nazi salute in front of the Gold Coast Hebrew Congregation in October last year.

title.children: Canberra man charged with performing Nazi salute outside synagogue

image.altText: A pharmacist in a chemist.

props.synopsis: Every morning when Chris Lawler opens the doors of his Canberran pharmacy, he knows some of the customers won’t be coming to purchase, but to steal. A new online portal offers hope things might get better.

title.children: Shoplifters raid this pharmacy ‘daily’, but police are too busy to act

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication reaches peak in Canberra

image.altText: Head on shot of the L2 Circular Quay light rail tram

props.synopsis: With light rails under construction around the nation, the case brought by Sydney businesses against Transport for NSW in the High Court today could set a precedent for compensation claims.

title.children: Should government pay for business woes over Sydney's light rail?

image.altText: A man in hand-cuffs is escorted by two police officers along a road.

props.synopsis: A case where a group of men allegedly impersonated police to break into a Mawson home appears before the ACT Magistrates Court, with police saying they believe the victim was mistakenly targeted.

title.children: Pair allegedly impersonated police in Canberra home invasion

image.altText: A black and white image of a nursey full of babies, with a blue cross above one baby's head and the word "Elizabeth".

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Wray and Rohan Samara are two of the thousands of children evacuated from Vietnam at the fall of Saigon 50 years ago as part of Operation Babylift. They're embarking on a quest to find their biological families.

title.children: Liz and Rohan arrived in Australia in boxes. They're looking for their families

image.altText: An illustration of a woman crying next to a burning house.

props.synopsis: The ABC went on a multi-country investigation in the Pacific to understand one of the world's worst gender violence crises. What we found was much more complicated than a story about victimhood.

title.children: When home becomes hell: Inside one of the world's worst gender violence crises

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: Neither Russian President Vladimir Putin nor his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy will attend talks in Istanbul. The question now is, will these talks amount to anything?

title.children: With Putin refusing to attend talks, Zelenskyy was left with two choices

image.altText: A man's side profile in shadows with a phone close to his face

props.synopsis: Online gambling provider PointsBet Australia has been fined for sending spam messages and marketing material to people who had registered to be excluded. Some experts have called on the federal government to set up a national gambling regulator.

title.children: PointsBet fined $500,000 after spamming customers with gambling ads

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: The South Australian premier says an investigation into an 18-year-old man's alleged threats of a "physical attack" at public events and to an Adelaide school was "the most complex" case he has been briefed on.

title.children: Teen called himself 'prophet of justice' in alleged school threats

image.altText: Sussan Ley, David Littleproud, Angus Taylor, Peter Dutton QT 20221027_041653670_iOS

props.synopsis: David Littleproud and Sussan Ley have had a previously combustible relationship but will have to find a path forward.

title.children: The Coalition must figure out its answer to the net zero question

image.altText: Two adults and three children running along a beach, laughing.

props.synopsis: Kate and Kriss Hardman are determined to make joyful memories with their three young children as they travel around Australia under the cloud of breast and prostate cancers.

title.children: Mum of three with terminal cancer says 'don't wait to live your life'

image.altText: A satellite image shows the tops of buildings from above.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a video it released that claimed to show Hamas-built tunnels underneath a southern Gaza hospital actually show different buildings.

title.children: Israel concedes error in video claiming to show Hamas tunnels under hospital

image.altText: People letting off fireworks on a beach

props.synopsis: More than 100 tonnes of fireworks bound for the NT's Territory Day celebrations have been seized by NSW authorities, prompting the NT chief minister to appeal to the NSW premier.

title.children: More than 100 tonnes of Territory Day fireworks seized by NSW authorities

image.altText: A young woman who was found dead south of Brisbane

props.synopsis: Nilisi Kaniki was sentenced for the manslaughter of Selma Ibrahim in the Supreme Court in Brisbane on Friday.

title.children: Man jailed for 15 years for killing pregnant partner and unborn child

image.altText: Ellouisa Brighton Gibson.

props.synopsis: Ellouisa Patricia Brighton, 36, was charged with three counts of murder, three counts of attempted murder and one count of arson following the deadly house fire in Toowoomba last week.

title.children: Mother charged with murder of three children has matter heard in court

image.altText: Ilona Maher celebrates by screaming

props.synopsis: With more social media followers than the two most popular men's players combined, USA centre Ilona Maher is a genuine sporting superstar and she is using her profile to raise women's rugby.

title.children: The bonafide rugby superstar attracting new fans to the sport

image.altText: Man speaks and points in parliament

props.synopsis: The NT Labor opposition claims the government pushed new sacred sites laws through parliament to help a hotel proposal at the Darwin Waterfront proceed.

title.children: Changes to NT sacred sites law pass parliament, to opposition criticism

image.altText: A series of houses in Sydney with numerous dollar signs edited into the picture next to the houses.

props.synopsis: Research from Cotality shows the portion of dwellings valued at $1 million or more has risen from just below 10 per cent in April 2015, to more than 34 per cent a decade later.

title.children: Why $1 million is far from an all-access pass to the housing market

image.altText: A generic photo of a baby lying in the lap of a doctor who is holding syringe.

props.synopsis: Vaccination rates among children and teens have dropped to "critical" levels, according to experts, who are warning deaths are inevitable if Australia doesn't do more to turn the trend around.

title.children: Australian vaccination rates plummeting among young children

image.altText: a overview of Bayesian yacht

props.synopsis: A superyacht belonging to British tech tycoon Mike Lynch, which sank off the coast of Italy last year, was most likely knocked over by violent winds, according to an interim UK report.

title.children: Mike Lynch's yacht tipped 90 degrees in less than 15 seconds

image.altText: A boy leans over a book and draws with a texter.

props.synopsis: Oliver arrived at Elaine's on the eve of his 7th birthday, with a black bin bag in tow. With no training to be a foster carer, she quit after three weeks.

title.children: 'I'm set up to fail': Foster carer quits after three weeks of caring for young boy

image.altText: Col Blanch speaking at a press conference

props.synopsis: A man dies in police custody after suffering a suspected cardiac arrest as officers and medical staff tried to subdue him inside Newman Hospital in WA's north.

title.children: Tussle with police in hospital ends in medical episode and man's death

image.altText: A woman in exercise gear at the summit of Mount Coolum.

props.synopsis: Being diagnosed with genital herpes as a teenager sent Jasmyn Gaggiano spiralling into depression. Since sharing her story, she has realised many others are suffering in silence.

title.children: Woman diagnosed with genital herpes as teen says shame was crippling

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: From party leadership votes to missing ballot papers and plunging spacecrafts to luxury aeroplanes, this week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new Liberal leader, a luxury aeroplane and Eurovision

image.altText: Two swimming pools with a river in the background.

props.synopsis: Liquidator documents reveal a community pool contractor has underpaid staff superannuation in Queensland and New South Wales, with the ATO also owed $1.4 million.

title.children: Lifeguards owed $400,000 in super as company enters liquidation

image.altText: Blue and white police tape at a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A man is in custody and homicide detectives are investigating after a 48-year-old woman was found dead in a home in western Victoria.

title.children: Woman found dead in country Victorian home

image.altText: A woman and a man in a house look scared at the camera.

props.synopsis: Plus Aussies react to Eurovision elimination, Cannes bans the nip slip, Sydney musical heading to the West End and more.

title.children: This Australian film sold for $26m. A new lawsuit says the idea was stolen

image.altText: Singer Cassie and Sean Combs pose on the red carpet, Diddy is wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The prosecution's star witness, Casandra "Cassie" Ventura, is cross-examined about drugs, sex and infidelity at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking and racketeering trial.

title.children: 'Always ready to freak off': Cassie quizzed over texts at Diddy trial

image.altText: A woman in a red dress with red painted nails toasting a man with champagne.

props.synopsis: In the 'sugar dating' world, attractive young women date rich older men to facilitate the kind of romance you pay for. But things can go wrong when sex mixes with money, wealth and power.

title.children: What life is like as a sugar baby who dates older men
